programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Intelligence teams up with ASA Chapman to take on an abduction case involving a teenager; the case hits close to home for Voight, leading him to take a personal interest in finding justice for the victim.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: An ongoing case hits close to home for Voight as Intelligence teams up with an SVU detective to track down a prolific offender.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: During a bank run for his off-duty security job, Halstead and his co-workers are attacked by a violent robbery crew, which leads to a shootout; Voight and Lindsay talk to a dispensary owner who says her business has received threats from local gangs.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The team discovers a secret battered woman's shelter and learns the owner has been wounded and a resident has been abducted; Burgess and Roman track down a man who has been catfishing people on a dating app to rob them.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When Burgess and Lindsay respond to a call about a stabbing, the assailant turns out to be a kidnapping victim escaping her captor; Ruzek accuses Roman of having feelings for Burgess.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: After a cold and unmoving newborn baby is discovered in a duffel bag on a Chicago lakefront, Chicago Med is able to provide information that helps zero in on a suspect; Roman and Burgess grow closer.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A con man cheats one of Nick's friends out of his retirement fund. Nick decides to help his friend return the favor. What they don't know is that the mob is involved.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A successful businessman fights with his wife a lot. When she is found dead, he is the prime suspect, so he hires Nick and Sylvie to prove his innocence. His business partner and even his kids are among the other potential suspects.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick and Sylvie are hired by an insurance company to investigate a porn mogul who bought life insurance for one of his girls just before she was murdered. As Nick and Sylvie soon find out, the hole goes much deeper than that.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: The recently fired DEA Agent & Ex-Royal Canadian Mounted Police Officer, Nick Slaughter, moves to the Florida beach resort town of Key Mariah & opens a detective agency with a feisty local travel agent named Sylvie Girard! Their first case comes when an old friend of Nick's from the Philadelphia Police department asks them to help catch a killer!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick Slaughter, a disgraced former Canadian Mountie, and DEA Agent moves to the tropical island paradise of Key Mariah. Once there he starts his own Private Detective Agency, and meets Sylvie Gerard, a local travel agent. Together they form a strong friendship and quite the detective team. However, the local police squad never make it easy for them luckily they have plenty of friends to help along the way. The Town of Key Mariah will never be the same again thanks to Nick Slaughter and company!

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil builds a bridge out of pasta; building with blocks; making a strong sand castle.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil tries to build a platform, on which he can levitate, out of magnets; magnet sculptures.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we meet the animals of Africa. We'll see how the zebra is able to use its stripes as camouflage against its colorblind nemesis. Explore the engineering of a giraffe's neck, and feel the power of a hyena's jaws.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: An Elephant seals nose inflates to amplify its roar, which can be heard up to a mile away! Plus, African wild dog have one of the most powerful bite forces on Earth! Giant ant eaters w/o teeth have 2 foot long tongues and can eat 30k insects per day!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at ways scientists are measuring the health of our forests. In New England, Philippe visits a white pine forest that is being threatened by invasive plants. At the University of California - Santa Cruz, students use sonic-tomography to look inside trees in order to detect any signs of disease. At the Pine Barrens of New Jersey, we learn about the pitch pine tree.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at new ways of cultivating fresh, nutritious food. He visits a farm in Los Angeles where they grow food on a parking lot, just to show that fresh food can be grown in an urban environment. We also look into what distinguishes fruits from vegetables. The results can be surprising. And then we look at the amount of food that is wasted world wide.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett tells the story of his last mission in North Korea as he and Catherine cross into the country to retrieve a friend's remains.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Steve and the team allow a talk-show host (Aisha Tyler) and her crew to follow them for a day, but a run-in with Wo Fat leads to danger.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a young girl's body is discovered 10 years after being kidnapped, the team searches for her abductors -- who have taken their next victim; Kono asks Catherine for a favor that could impact her relationship with Adam.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett helps his mother with a covert op in hope of retrieving an incriminating microfiche; Kono runs into danger as she closes in on Adam's secret.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Kono is blamed for a murder she did not commit; McGarrett's visit to Wo Fat leads to a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Following McGarrett and Wo Fat's escape, gunmen hit Five-0 headquarters; McGarrett must turn on his own in order to find Catherine.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: As the Five-0 team members investigate a murder, they are led to a Texas ranger (Tim Daly) who came to Hawaii to look for his daughter; Adam and Kono fight to stay alive.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a missing artifact seems to be the key to solving a double murder, a conspiracy theorist (Jorge Garcia) helps the team.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a wedding crasher is murdered, a runaway bride is the prime suspect; Danny makes a decision about his relationship with Gabby.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum starts following Higgins to discover what she's been hiding, as she's secretly assigned to infiltrate a group threatening to take down MI-6; Rick struggles after an explosion takes the life of someone important to him.

programme.desc: A Christmas Eve ransomware attack on the Honolulu Police Department forces Lia to reveal a family secret to Magnum and Katsumoto.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: When a woman hires Magnum and Higgins to locate a man she met briefly at a coffee shop and felt a spark with, they learn that he is hiding a big secret; Higgins keeps a secret of her own after she has a romantic dream about Magnum.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: A nun hires Magnum to investigate a mysterious and large cash donation made to a parishioner undergoing medical treatment; Jin's new dog walking business takes a dramatic turn; Rick nervously prepares to reconnect with Suzy.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Shammy asks Magnum and Higgins to locate his missing friend, a homeless veteran; T.C. tries to get Cade to return to school but quickly learns it's not that simple.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: When Hawaii Supreme Court nominee Judge Rachel Park is being blackmailed, she hires Magnum and Higgins who go to extraordinary lengths to help her out; Rick suggests changes to make La Mariana more profitable.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: A bail bondsman hires Magnum and Higgins to track down a woman who skipped out on her $250,000 bond; T.C. and Katsumoto team up on an emotional search for Cade's mother.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A businessman is opening a casino with his shady partners. Sylvie Falls in love with him and leaves her detective partnership behind to work for him.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A meek owner of a diamond and jewelry company hires Nick and Sylvie to find out if his hot, unhappy, and flirty wife is having an affair. Nick and Sylvie track her down only to witness her being murdered by her angry lover.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth interrupts Brennan's vacation with her boyfriend (Eddie McClintock) to get help with the case of a woman whose boneless body was found in a river.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a water main bursts at a cemetery, Brennan must identify and help reinter the remains that litter the grounds.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth suspects an organized-crime family when a partial skeleton is found encased in concrete, and he tries to lure the suspected killer out of hiding; Brennan gets a surprise visit from her father (Ryan O'Neal) while visiting her mother's grave.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When Brennan and Booth investigate a body that was found in a crater, evidence suggests that it had been in outer space.

programme.desc: When a teenage girl disappears, the squad discovers a suspect who seems to be targeting young, vulnerable women with a similar personal connection; Dr. Huang delves into his past in order to help solve the case.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.desc: When a child is severely injured by falling in a swimming pool, the man looking after her is arrested.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.desc: According to physicist Bob Lazar, Element 115 is the fuel source for an alien spacecraft he was hired to reverse-engineer by the U.S. government to find a way to harness its power.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Top 50 Plays of the Week
programme.desc: Top 50 Plays of the Week

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The engineering on the convertible C10 works in theory, but making it work in practice is the next step; a team brings in a replica 1967 Cobra with a bad engine.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Of all the different years and generations of the VW Bug, there is one that stands out among the rest -- the Hebmüller; there are maybe 200 of them left, so in addition to being hard to find, they are truly the holy grail of VWs.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The build continues, and the challenge is to keep what makes the car a Hebmueller intact, while taking bold steps to turn it into a hot rod. Dave keeps the traditional two-tone exterior, but modifying it to an automatic is a huge test for the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Normally when Kindig-It Design attends a car show, their cars are the ones being judged. But this time around, Dave and Kev hold the keys and will have to select the top 10 builders out of the hundreds of cars that arrive for the show.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave's clients have owned a car since they got married 25 years ago and want it restored so they can enjoy it for another 25. While the shop isn't really into straight restorations, adding some custom pieces and paint makes them "say yes" to the pro.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is thrilled with the latest build, while KevDogg is barely lukewarm; Dave has done double-cab VWs, Bugs and Karmann Ghias, but now he is taking on something completely different, and even more rare.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Matching the two-tone paint job is the challenge of the day as the '53 Barn Door Deluxe build carries on; custom trim, a new, more powerful engine, 22 windows and a custom interior all come together to make this surprise worth the wait.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the guys at Kindig-It proved they could execute Dave's vision of his production Corvette, but now that a few have sold, they have to get them completely finished.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team put the finishing touches on the first-ever Kindig CF Corvettes to complete a lifelong dream; however, the clients argue about who will get the first one, all in advance of a once-in-a-lifetime debut at SEMA.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin, who have been an absolute treat for automotive enthusiasts for years, come back to the SEMA show with something special on their minds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Beatles fanatic challenges Dave to paint a modern Rolls-Royce to match the car John Lennon commissioned in the late 1960s.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show as far east as they have ever gone and head to Lake George, New York, for the Adirondack Nationals; the town shuts down for the car show, attracting some of the best on the east coast.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1970s Pantera is an iconic sportscar, but once Dave gets his hands on it, the style will never be the same; the client has given Dave free rein to change the car as he sees fit, but has one request: he is 6'4" and can't comfortably get in it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: With the whole team in agreement over the body mods, the crew must make the designs into reality; their list of tasks include bulging out the fenders, creating a spider-shaped exhaust, executing the stretch and getting the car to body.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Pantera is almost done, but nothing is simple with this car; Dave and Kev get a chance to upgrade their semi rig.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1971 Chevy Nova with tremendous pedigree arrives at the shop to get classic Kindig-It styling cues; Dave wants to make this car into a hardtop; tucked-in bumpers, front valance and a new engine provide a good test for the crew.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Will makes miracles happen, and Dave decides to make a wholesale change to the car's color; challenges mount at each stage of the build, and the upholstery shop changes up their routine as the client arrives for a reveal years in the making.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: While the shop perfects its process in building the CF1s, word about the car spreads and potential buyers line up; the latest client has a big problem when he can't choose the perfect color combination.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show to the Midwest, as more than 2,500 cars descend on the Summit Motorsports drag strip for a weekend of fun; Kev gets a ride in a lean, mean drag racing machine; Dave steps up his autocross game.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client enlists Dave on a mission from God to make his dreams of a father/son road trip along Route 66 come true; getting the client's mechanically unsound reproduction of the Bluesmobile ready for the road will test the crew's mettle.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Kevin Schiele breathes new life into a semi-hauler by giving it a visual and functional upgrade that impeccably reflects his expertise in trucks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave finally realizes one of his dreams by opening the Kindig Academy.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team determine that a '69 Camaro requires a full rebuild.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Camaro build hits a snag as the crew tries to get the engine dialed in.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repair turns into a full rebuild for a show-ready '35 Roadster.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop hits the road with their freshest builds for a show in Colorado.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The owner of an iconic '55 Nomad wants to boost the power with a blower.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Rick Mezich from "Deadliest Catch" tests Dave's design prowess on his CF1.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Hummer comes in for a 4WD conversion, engine swap, interior and paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop has a busy week prepping for the 2022 SEMA show in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave makes modifications to the latest CF1 and announces a pinewood derby.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew gears up for the last car show of the year in Scottsdale, Arizona.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A beat-up truck arrives, but underneath all the rust lies a hidden gem.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The body work on the C10 is where the art of the build truly comes out.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Challenges still lie ahead as the C10 moves into final assembly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: After a nationwide search to find the best metal fabrication prospects around, Dave Kindig and KevDogg have invited 12 people to the shop to compete for one job at Kindig-It Design.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The remaining competitors pair up for a challenge to create a signature Kindig-It build feature; teamwork is critical, and the team that can't figure it out will pack their bags.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave and Kev divide the group into two teams, and explain the day's assignment; the teams must navigate a tricky exhaust challenge; the losing team will have to make a difficult choice.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Project managers are chosen; designing and executing a wing on a '68 Camaro trunk lid.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: A rusted out, dented fender needs repair, and at the last minute, Dave and Kev throw a curveball.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The ultimate job interview is down to four candidates, and the next test will see how well they can handle a staple project at Kindig-It Design; even with the instructions available, this challenge is not as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave challenges the remaining three players to fabricate a grill from design to execution, with the winners getting a spot in the finale.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The final two are ready to prove themselves; Dave and Kev throw another curveball.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Some players only shine bright in the NFL for one season. Check out which guys made the cut for our top 10 list of one-year wonders.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Anthony Richardson, the No. 4 overall pick in the 2023 NFL draft ran for a 4-yard touchdown, his second of the game, with 46 seconds left in his return from a two-game benching to lift the Colts to a 28-27 victory over Aaron Rodgers and the New York Jets on Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Quarterback Jordan Love and Green Bay Packers outduel quarterback Caleb Williams and the Chicago Bears with help from a blocked field goal as time expired.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Josh Allen's touchdown on fourth-and-2 with 2:17 left sealed Buffalo's 30-21 victory, kept the Bills (9-2) in contention for the AFC's top seed and spoiled the two-time defending Super Bowl champion Chiefs' bid for a perfect season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Pittsburgh's defense stifled Lamar Jackson and the NFL's top-ranked offense on Sunday as the Steelers topped their AFC North rivals behind Chris Boswell's franchise-tying six field goals in an 18-16 victory.

programme.desc: Detroit Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford ripped the Eagles for 337 yards and 5 TDs, with Johnson accounting for 93 receiving yards and 3 of those TDs. Calvin Johnson set the record for most receiving TDs in Thanksgiving history.

programme.title: NFL Top 10
programme.desc: Countdown of the best moments from past Thanksgiving Day games.

programme.title: Evolution of Thanksgiving Games
programme.desc: From the 1934 Lions to John Madden's Turducken, watch the greatest moments in NFL Thanksgiving history.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: From Peyton Manning vs. Ryan Leaf to Bryce Young vs. C.J. Stroud, check out every time the top two picks from the draft played against each other during their rookie seasons.

programme.title: Weekly Game Recaps
programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Weekly Game Previews
programme.desc: This weekly series breaks down what you need to know for every NFL matchup ahead of Week 12.

programme.title: NFL Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from the National Football League.

programme.title: NFL GameDay View
programme.desc: Host Patrick Claybon and a panel of experts pick every game on the NFL schedule with insights from reporters around the country and in-depth statistical analysis, plus feedback from fans as they make their vote on who will win each week.

programme.title: NFL Daily
programme.desc: Gregg Rosenthal and a rotating crew of elite NFL Media co-hosts, including Patrick Claybon, Colleen Wolfe, Steve Wyche, Nick Shook and Jourdan Rodrigue of The Athletic get viewers caught up daily on all the NFL news and analysis.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Christian McCaffrey capped a game-winning, 69-yard drive by running for his second touchdown with 1:07 to play, and the 49ers held on to beat the Green Bay Packers 24-21 in a divisional-round thriller on Saturday night.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Some players only shine bright in the NFL for one season. Check out which guys made the cut for our top 10 list of one-year wonders.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Anthony Richardson, the No. 4 overall pick in the 2023 NFL draft ran for a 4-yard touchdown, his second of the game, with 46 seconds left in his return from a two-game benching to lift the Colts to a 28-27 victory over Aaron Rodgers and the New York Jets on Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Quarterback Jordan Love and Green Bay Packers outduel quarterback Caleb Williams and the Chicago Bears with help from a blocked field goal as time expired.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Josh Allen's touchdown on fourth-and-2 with 2:17 left sealed Buffalo's 30-21 victory, kept the Bills (9-2) in contention for the AFC's top seed and spoiled the two-time defending Super Bowl champion Chiefs' bid for a perfect season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Pittsburgh's defense stifled Lamar Jackson and the NFL's top-ranked offense on Sunday as the Steelers topped their AFC North rivals behind Chris Boswell's franchise-tying six field goals in an 18-16 victory.

programme.title: Charlotte
programme.desc: From Charlotte Motor Speedway in Concord, NC.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Built around the uncanny events of February 19, 1979, A Perfect Storm chronicles how a major blizzard created an audience for the first-ever live broadcast of the Daytona 500 and television's big gamble on the sport. Seamlessly combining a mix of the race broadcast, recently uncovered archives and news footage, plus first person accounts from the broadcasters, newsmakers, competitors and fans who experienced the day that changed NASCAR and sports broadcasting forever.

programme.title: Fort Dobbs
programme.desc: After escaping a lynch mob, Gar Davis (Clint Walker) disguises himself in a dead man's clothes and stumbles upon a farm. When Comanches attack the homestead, Gar leaps into action to defend the hapless residents -- widow Celia Gray (Virginia Mayo) and her son Chad (Richard Eyer). A tenuous romance develops between Gar and Celia when he escorts the family to Fort Dobbs. But everything changes when Celia discovers the stranger is wearing her dead husband's jacket.

Joey and Fury form a special bond and embark upon lifetime adventures at the Broken Wheel Ranch!

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: With the Mississippi River rising towards a record flood, the only thing that could save New Orleans would be to punch a hole in a levee up-river. Such an action would inundate Lady Charity's new plantation & she isn't willing to allow it! Yancy and Colton try to negotiate, but Lady Charity refuses to budge and instead turns to escaped convict, Rogue Donovan, to protect her land.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy wins a half-share of a Virginia City silver mine and must immediately utilize its assets when the boiler on his riverboat blows up. To collect his assets, he travels to Virginia City, where he meets his beautiful partner, Julia Bulette. She explains that the mine dried out, but Yancy soon discovers that workers from a neighboring mine have been stealing their valuable ore.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: After an accident involving Ben and a gun leaves him paralyzed, Tom Edwards' ranch goes under. The Cartwrights offer to help by building a mill.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When a family of Quakers are targeted by locals and Adam and his new companion, Sam, offer to escort them, Sam devises a plan to rob them instead.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When a number of ranchers are robbed and killed, posses are sent after suspects who are never found--perhaps because they're hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When Ben repays an Indian man for saving his life by giving him and his wife some of his land, prejudice erupts on both sides.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: The daughter of a rich man is abducted and held for ransom, but the plan unravels when she is killed and her lover finds out who did it.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Fed up with her controlling father, Dolly Kincaid runs away with her boyfriend, who she discovers is a leader to a group of murderous bank robbers.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A long-lost relative of the Cartwright family arrives at the Ponderosa, but he happens to also be the leader of a band of criminals.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie has double duty this time when she matches wits with Dana and Jana Matthews, twin sisters. With Pistols and Boots she has to do battle with this dynamite duo.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: When he is unable to save his own father, Diablo's town doctor loses his confidence in himself. It's up to Annie to convince him that Diablo needs him and that you must get right back up...

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Link and Evie Tabor have been struggling, working their ranch, ever since Link was injured in a rodeo mishap and confined to a wheel chair.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: The newly arrived Peters family seem to be angry at the world and want nothing but to be left alone.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: When a beautiful woman robs the bank, the young bank teller is accused and it's up to Annie to find evidence to prove he is innocent and that she is guilty, unbelievable as it seems.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Unexpected trouble comes to a rancher who hires ex-convict Steve Bailey.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: When a section of the territory is opened for settlement, Ralph and Mary plan to race in the land rush and claim a fertile piece of land Mary's father discovered in his travels years before.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Della envies Annie's freedom and trick riding skills. When the rodeo comes to town, Della's father refuses to allow her to meet her boyfriend, one of the best competitors.

programme.desc: A boy asks Hoppy to investigate the death of his father who was killed after being accused of cheating at cards.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy helps persuade an Indian chief to reveal the location where crude oil can be found on the land's surface before an outsider grabs the land.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: While in Mexico on business, Hoppy and Red agree to help a blind woman's son who is falsely accused on murder.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Red uses $1000 of Hoppy's money to invest in scrub land, because he hears of an irrigation ditch being dug to bring water to the worthless tract.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: The U.S. Army asks Hoppy to investigate when a herd of horses desperately needed for the Spanish-American War is stolen from the ranch who was supposed to supply the herd.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy must work fast to prevent a range war between the cattleman's associaton and the interlopers.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: While searching for a missing calf, Hoppy and Red are shot at from ambush. Hoppy isn't too concerned about the misunderstanding - the youths paid for the calf, after all - until he learns that the money he was paid with is counterfeit.

programme.title: Roughshod
programme.desc: Rancher Clay (Robert Sterling) and his brother, Steve (Claude Jarman Jr.), head out across the Sonora mountain pass, followed by Lednov (John Ireland), an ex-con seeking revenge on Clay for putting him behind bars. Clay and Steve unexpectedly cross paths with a group of dance hall girls -- including Mary (Gloria Grahame), Marcia (Martha Hyer) and Helen (Myrna Dell) -- whose stagecoach has broken down, and help them get to the nearest ranch, where Lednov unfortunately catches up to Clay.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt goes sinister Hangtown due to a dying man's last request.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: A gang of thieves tries to frame Corey Harris.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Travelers have been disappearing near an ancient inn.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Painless Pepper has plans to extract more than teeth.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark's careless actions cause the death of a friend. Unable to accept the truth, he blames the rifle and runs away from home. Soon, he is faced with a tough decision.

programme.desc: Lucas's self-confidence begins to slip away when he misses an easy shot that could have cost Mark his life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark and Lucas run into Micah on the trail and help when the prisoner he is transporting injures his arm. Lucas' life is endangered when a snake crawls into his bed.

programme.desc: While Mark goes hunting for Old Spike, Lucas goes hunting for his mortal enemy. Lucas is thrown into jail to stop him from murdering his former friend.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas gets in trouble when he accuses the foreman of a neighboring ranch of rustling some of his cattle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark are returning from a big cattle sale when the stage is robbed by three outlaws. Lucas, desperate to recover the money that was stolen, is determined to pursue the outlaws.

programme.desc: Lucas and Mark find themselves exposed to anthrax after they adopt a stray horse whose owner has been killed in a gunfight.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.desc: Poems by the Emperor of Japan; Brice's advice for breaking into showbiz.

programme.desc: A businessman just stares; a man debates whether he should call a girl; the cops wonder why someone would abandon a perfectly good potato.

programme.title: A Frosty Affair
programme.desc: An unexpected road trip during a blizzard with a stranger to make her wedding forces a small-town teacher to take a hard look at her life choices.

programme.title: Christmas Casanova
programme.desc: Podcaster Elise partners with Daniyal to create an unforgettable Christmas, but it seems he's wooing the wrong woman amidst the festive chaos.

programme.title: Christmas Coupon
programme.desc: An ice skating instructor reunites with her high school sweetheart, now a professional hockey player, when he signs his niece up for skating lessons.

programme.title: Grumpy Old Santa
programme.desc: Nic’s life plan derails when his wife leaves. Five years later, a secret romance brings unexpected joy and uproarious complications.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Black Horse Inn in North Yorkshire, where unlikely double act manager Steve Barker and side-kick and bar manager Callum Dixon believe they can win their guests over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to The Shores Hotel in Blackpool, where bed and breakfast beginner Enid Hall prides herself in offering clean rooms at bargain prices. However, the guests are not as impressed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Hilltop Hideaways in Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, where cousins in law Lottie and Lil Ellis are on a mission to put the glamorous in glamping.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Runswick Bay, Yorkshire and The Cliffemount Hotel, with general manager Garry Healey and housekeeper Zara Doherty. They hope the views be enough to wow the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Next up is the Quayside Hotel in Boston, Lincolnshire, run by Alistair and partner Lana, where most of the guests are bowled over by the bling, but Claire feels stuck in a neon nightmare.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Hollington Park Glamping near Newbury, run by couple Claire and Adam. Daniele and Chantal are happy glampers, but the other guests are shocked by their surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Swan House in Kelvedon, Essex, where owner Daniele is joined by sister Chantal. On arrival, the traditional décor impresses, but Lana is left with wardrobe woes.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire run by colleagues Genice Hall and Cathy Hudson. There's a battle of the breakfasts, and feedback that cuts deep.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Railway Inn near Hull, run by couple Lydia Perkins and Luke Mainprize. The guests find little to complain about, but the pressure is on for Luke's breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Driftwood bed and breakfast in Weymouth, run by Sarah and Pete Healey. On arrival Cathy and Genice find the place completely ship shape and Lygia spies the host's disco balls.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Bull Hotel in Wrotham, Kent, where owner Lygia Fontanella-Deadman and breakfast chef Mary Murray pride themselves on a luxury stay, but emotions run high.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Nottinghamshire at The Clumber Park Hotel, where general Manager Rajesh Saraf and his colleague Yuanee Tampoe believe all guests should be treated as gods.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Family Tree in Derbyshire, where owners Charlie and Sam Cameron want their guests to feel like one of the family. However, some of them are creeped out by the rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group heads to The Royal Hotel in Sheerness, Kent, where partners Sarah Lewry and Gareth Segrove believe they offer great value for money, but the guests have a lot to say.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's final visit is to Adhurst Yurts in Hampshire, where owner Alison Lubbock is on a mission to educate her guests to think green, but they question the provenance of her produce.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Sancton, Yorkshire and The North Star Club, owned by Carolyn Van Outersterp and daughter Galatea who hope their peaceful woodland cabins will win over the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Friends Bed and Breakfast in Blackpool, Lancashire run by Luke and John Conway, who are the self-proclaimed unique selling point. But feedback from some leaves a bitter taste.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to The Lincoln Holiday Retreat, which owner Debbie Grant has built from the ground up over the past twenty years. However, some of the guests think the décor is too dated.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Chapel in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, owned by Mark Hinchcliffe and Heidi Donohoe, who pride themselves on offering something special in their converted chapel.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Heather and Sally hope their fussy cleaning regime will impress their rivals at Brockley Hall Hotel in Yorkshire. But there are problems in some rooms, and the breakfast puzzles the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Alistair, who has fitted out luxury hotels including The Savoy, welcomes his rivals to his refurbished village pub, The Star Inn 1744, where his breakfast ordering system raises questions.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Michelle and Jason welcome their rivals to their luxury lodges at Croft Farm Park in Gloucestershire. The guests go canoeing but some struggle to stay afloat when someone sticks his oar in.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Tracy welcome their rivals to their bed and breakfast Harbour Vista in Poole, and most of their guests are surprised that it's not more lavish, when they realise they are staying in Steve's house.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Grosmont, North Yorkshire, at Grosmont House B&B, mother and daughter Selma and Roxy hope their personal touch and attention to detail will win over their competitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Monkspool bed and breakdast in Twyning, Gloucestershire. The establishment is owned by husband and wife Paulo and Suzi Lacey, who pride themselves on their top-quality mattresses.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to Pymgate Lodge Hotel in Cheadle, where Romanian husband and wife Michael and Leda Ardeleanu believe their hosting skills will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to pub, restaurant and bed and breakfast The Stag and Huntsman in Hambleden, Oxfordshire, managed by South African chef Marius Pretorius and his partner Sarah Harris.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Weymouth, Dorset at The Somerset House Hotel, run by couple Adam and Holly, who hope their boutique rooms and BBQ breakfast will whet their guests' appetite.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Dawlish in Devon, where owner of The Knitting Hotel Belinda Harris-Reid and colleague Brenda Watson are hoping their guests get excited about all things woolly.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Stade Court Hotel in Hythe in Kent, where the owners, Sandeep and Vaishalee Chawla, have a hosting policy of treating their guests like a god.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mandy McCready and her assistant Sam Gould welcome their rivals to the Goodlife Guest House, a family business in Harwich in Essex.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ronnie and Steph Caird welcome their rivals to Inn at the Park in Aberdeen. where it is all about keeping it in the family. But one guest's culinary background piles on the pressure for Ronnie at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Shauna and Fiona welcome their rivals to Ingliston Country Club in Renfrewshire. But Steve and Allard think the décor is dated, and a breakfast waiting game causes a storm in a teacup.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Allard welcome their rivals to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District. Fiona and Shauna think it's picture perfect, but other guests face tricky technology and cleanliness concerns.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Blackpool and confident John welcomes his rivals to the Lynbar Hotel. He says his breakfast is the best in Blackpool and hopes his guests will agree.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Wales and the School House bed and breakfast, owned by eco-friendly couple Jayne and Ian, where they hope their environmental approach will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey and Assistant Manager Jo Goodwin. Guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but the costs prove hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Leafy Suburban bed and breakfast in Northwood, where golfer Raj Kumar opens the doors to his home. However, Neil and Jo are not impressed with a surprise visitor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Wellington Inn in Hertfordshire where resources manager Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach to hosting - but the `Welly' twist is not a hit with everyone.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Strontian Boutique in Strontian, Scotland, where Callum Pegg and his partner head chef Darren Anderson want to treat their guests to an exclusive stay.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to The Helix Hotel in Grangemouth, Stirlingshire, where host Nawaz Haq wants to show off his hotel, catering to the travelling businessman. Come morning, the group raises concerns over the breakfast banquet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Black Boy Hotel in Sudbury, where hosts Kate Martin and sister Marie Carlton want their guests to kick back and embrace the historical surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to The Lodge Bed and Breakfast in Cannock, Staffordshire, where hosts Lee and Marie Garnett are hoping their guests take to their homely BandB, but have they done enough to win?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent run by 21-year-old partners James Tindall and Jessica Walton, who believe age is but a number. Over breakfast, a frank airing of views sets the standard for the week.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, run by mother and daughter duo Amanda and Becci. On arrival, everyone is wowed by the stylish shepherd huts with outside bath.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions are simmering as the guests head to The White House in Brighton.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business. The criticism continues, with feedback that leaves the hosts praying for a miracle.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Beam and Jets, Field Goal Swing, The Toothbrush Bristles, Tippy Tables and Dock Maze are among some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is La Lanterna in Letchworth, Hertfordshire. Twenty-eight-year-old owner and head chef Alex offers modern Italian cuisine, a taste of Little Italy in England's first garden city, and the restaurant is run by his best mate maitre dé Gavin, helped by his ex-air hostess girlfriend Emily. But Alex has no customers, cookers that don't work and an expensive menu that's about as authentically Italian as a spag bol.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is D-Place in Chelmsford, Essex run by Mexican-born Israel and his English partner Tara. They've sunk ~£150,000 of their own money into their trendy café bar which offers a vast selection of fusion cuisine. In charge is Executive Chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked.

In charge is Executive Chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S02:E01 - Episode 1

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew is attempting to pay tribute to NHS staff with his take on a traditional healing recipe, `Mum's Flu-Fighting Chicken Soup'. Jason's `A Tea From The Heart' is a play on a post-war remedy which harks back to the era when the NHS was formed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After the starter results, the chefs return to the kitchen hoping for high scores with their fish dishes. Chris once again is using ingredients he has foraged from around his restaurant, while Jason hopes to impress with a spicy scallop dish and Andrew prepares a cod dish with 11 different elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are pulling out all the stops in a bid for big scores with their mains. All three dishes pay tribute to the founder of the NHS Aneurin Bevan, Chris's `Everything But The Squeal' is an ambitious pork sharing platter, while Jason's `For The Rich And The Poor' showcases lamb, and Andrew is hoping to impress with `Aneurin Bevan For Better Steak'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the dessert course and the last opportunity for the chefs to impress. Chris is hoping to triumph with another dish which showcases the foraged ingredients available around his restaurant, while Jason attempts a technical feat in his dessert inspired by a childhood hospital stay and Andrew is inspired by a dish by his great grandmother used to cook. Which two will make it through to the judging chamber?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Wales regional final as the two remaining chefs do everything they can to impress the judging panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. After tensions ran high in the week, the chefs are under pressure to deliver perfection. The judges are joined by Aneira Thomas, the first baby born on the NHS, who is named in tribute to the service's founder Aneurin Bevan and who went on to dedicate her life to the service. Who will win a place in the national finals?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of three chefs representing the south west, including two who have competed before but meet in the kitchen this week for the very first time. The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their celebratory starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and with Tom renowned as a fish specialist all eyes are on him. He's cooking his take on a classic British fish supper in tribute to a charity which looks after the health of local fishermen. Jude is attempting a complex fusion dish featuring four different fish and an unusual X Ray themed presentation, while Olivia is paying tribute to the staff who looked after her during the birth of her first son with her take on curried monkfish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and two of the chefs are hoping duck will win the day. Tom is preparing a technically challenging duck dish steeped in NHS history while Jude is making a multi-element Chinese duck dish inspired by his mum. Olivia is hoping her dish, using two unusual cuts of beef, will score top points. Olivia also visits her local children's hospital, home of the second busiest paediatric A&E in the country.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With just one more chance to impress their veteran judge, the chefs are all hoping to use their pastry skills to deliver technically complex desserts. Tom's cooking an `Invalid Fruit Tart' inspired by a 1950s recipe, while Jude is making six different apple elements for his `An Apple A Day'. Olivia is using stout in reference to an outdated old wives' tale which suggested the drink was a healthy source of iron during pregnancy.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's time for the two remaining chefs representing the South West to go head to head as they cook their menus again for the exacting panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. With a spot in the National Finals at stake, both are aiming for perfection as they bid for glory. The judges are joined by Barbara Childs, a Matron in the Cardiac Intensive Care Unit at Great Ormond Street Hospital, who isn't afraid to speak her mind in the chamber.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs take to the kitchen in a bid to represent the north west in the national final. They include Ellis Barrie, from the award winning Marram Grass in Anglesey, Liam Simpson-Trotman, an accomplished pastry chef and co-owner of the 4 AA rosette Orwell's in Oxfordshire, and Craig Sherrington, who sharpened his skills working under top names including Eric Chavot and is now Chef Patron of Virginia House in Cumbria.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and the chefs are all gunning for tens. Craig pays tribute to a friend who has revolutionised hospital food in Morecambe Bay, while Liam is inspired by health advice his grandma gave him and Ellis is dedicating his dish to the staff who delivered his son Albert. With cod, mackerel, shrimp and cockles on the menu, which of the chefs will score highly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Time for the chefs to cook their mains and the pressure is on. Craig is hoping to impress using two cuts of Dexter beef, while Liam prepares his take on a Bajan lamb stew and Ellis prepares four cuts of suckling pig. Liam meets his personal hero, Nola Ishmael OBE, who became the UK's first ever black Director of Nursing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the North West chefs to impress in a bid to make it through to the regional final. Liam is cooking `Not So Hot Toddy' in honour of a friend who works nightshifts in the NHS, while Ellis' `Worth Their Weight in Gold' is dedicated to the staff who saved his brother's life and Craig's dish `The Missed Celebration' pays tribute to his wife with an unusual Christmas concept.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the week return to cook their menus again. Judging them are Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and Andi Oliver who are joined by Dr Jake Dunning MBE, an infectious disease specialist who has been recognised for his work during the West Africa Ebola epidemic.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs are doing battle to represent Northern Ireland. Tommy Heaney, Head Chef at the Great House Hotel in South Wales is taken on by Shauna Froydenlund, Chef Patron at Marcus Wareing's two Michelin starred restaurant and James Devine, the 2017 National Chef of the Year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course, the chefs return to the kitchen to cook their fish dishes. James is making his elevated take on a fried chicken takeaway as a tribute to the NHS staff who care for his sister. Shauna is also taking inspiration from a personal connection with a tribute to staff from a facility in her hometown of Londonderry. Tommy is hoping to impress with a dish dedicated to the discovery of DNA.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With two courses down it's time for the chefs to cook their main courses. It's the battle of beef with each using the same meat in their innovative creations. Tommy also meets the first baby ever born on the NHS.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the final chance for the chefs to impress. After such a tightly fought battle all week, each is hoping to deliver a technically perfect dessert. Tommy and James are both using passion fruit in their complex dishes while Shauna is hoping to use her pastry chef training to score full marks.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs representing Northern Ireland go head to head. Judging as ever are Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver who are joined by Shehan Hettiaratchy, lead trauma surgeon at St Mary's Hospital who helped treat victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs from all eight regions must battle it out for the honour of a spot on 2018's `Feast To Say Thank You' banquet menu, celebrating 70 years of the NHS, one of Britain's most prized institutions.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but after some exceptionally high-scoring dishes in the starter round, everyone is desperate to deliver perfection. Once again the chefs present their innovative, witty or heart-warming creations.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. Both chefs and judges alike are amazed at the high standard of cooking and an incredible number of 10s are dished out as the chefs serve up venison, rabbit, duck, beef, lamb and pork for scrutiny.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and with just one place remaining at the banquet feast, each chef is giving everything they've got for a chance to say thank you to the heroic NHS staff. All the chefs have significantly re-worked or re-invented their desserts since the regional heats, proving that they'll do everything they can in a bid for that final winning spot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale as the winning chefs cook their dishes at a banquet for the heroes of the NHS. Having arrived at St Bartholomew's Hospital, the chefs are shown the incredible location for event, the almost three-hundred-year-old Great Hall.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon and Tim Bilton prepare their starters which include potted venison with watercress and crisp fennel salad, `salmagundi' of North County produce, and sticky pigeon breast, forager's relish, hedgerow and beetroot crisps.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon and Tim Bilton prepare their fish dishes: seafood stew, fish soup with a toasted kipper club sandwich and hot oak smoked Kilnsey trout, golden tea cream and Daleside scraps.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon, and Tim Bilton make haymaker's twice-baked Nidderdale lamb, bluemin white potatoes and gravy, suckling pig with pork pies, black pudding, Scotch eggs and sticky spare ribs, and whole roast stuffed suckling pig.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the North East to impress. Tim Bilton, Andrew Pern and Stephanie Moon deliver their desserts which include gooseberry and apple crumble, a celebration of rhubarb and custard and Yorkshire mess.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs remain, as they cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the Northern Ireland chefs Brian McCann, Chris Bell and Chris Fearon. They kick things off with their starters which include hot and cold meats with pickles, brown bag coronation chicken and a summer picnic.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Northern Ireland chefs Brian McCann, Chris Bell and Chris Fearon prepare fish dishes including baked turbot, preserved salmon and smoked wild sea trout.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Northern Ireland chefs Brian McCann, Chris Bell and Chris Fearon prepare main courses including roast crown of lamb, `my fancy dressed piggy' and suckling pig.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Northern Ireland chefs Brian McCann, Chris Bell and Chris Fearon prepare desserts, including chocolate fondue, a mishmash of lemon and summer berry tart.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The judges aren't easily pleased and only first-class cooking will do. Just one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the People's Banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: North west chefs Bruno Birkbeck, Johnnie Mountain and Lisa Allen prepare their starters to be judged by Richard Corrigan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: North West chefs Bruno Birkbeck, Johnnie Mountain and Lisa Allen pull out all the stops with their fish dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation’s gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Kew on a Plate
programme.desc: It's autumn at Kew, and the vegetable garden is set to produce a bumper harvest.

programme.title: Kew on a Plate
programme.desc: As the year at Kew draws to an end, the garden is prepared for its next cycle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Public competition, little sleep, mother nature, and a wrong turn. It's a rough weekend for the Arkansas opener but Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell wouldn't be anywhere else. It's the Super Bowl of Duck Hunting and everyone is ready to hit the timber.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan is still hunting hard for the buck they call the "Wide 9". With the Georgia rut in full swing and bucks running everywhere the odds are getting better for Tyler to get a shot at him with his Hoyt bow. While Tyler hunts one end of Realtree Farms, land manger, Wes Doughtery is on the other end chasing a buck he has been after for quite some time. The rut in Georgia is in full swing and there is no better time than now to be in a tree stand.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green heads down to South Louisiana to finish out duck and deer season. The first morning duck hunt was absolutely epic with a 7 man limit at 7:35 am. Day 3 in the deer blind proved to be all Riley needed to close out his deer season with a big, wide 10 point!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck gives a history lesson on hip hop and duck hunting in the Oklahoma Timber.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: This week's episode takes place at the famed Honey Brake in Louisiana. Drake White kicks things off with a big 8-pointer, capping off an amazing comeback story for him. Riley Green continues his hot streak and takes a target buck. Finally, Tyler Jordan rounds out the incredible trip with his best buck ever. It's a giant typical.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell meet a new friend at the boat ramp. The group teams up in the timber. Then, an afternoon scouting trip pays off as the pair finds new water and new ducks.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: East Alton, Illinois is the home of Winchester Ammunition and the manufacturing home of the shotshell plants that build and produce millions of rounds of ammo for hunters, sport shooters, military and law enforcement. Get an unprecedented inside look at the birth cycle of a shotshell inside the walls of Winchester. From hull to primer, shot to wad and packaging to shipping, watch how the most legendary and successful ammunition brand in the world comes to is born and built.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Join us at Pelican’s Roost in Delacroix, LA, where Captain Sean Thornton and Chef Jay Ducote were able to share the full Louisiana Catch & Cook experience with Texas Food Personality Trey “Chow Down” Chapman—with delicious results.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: When most people visit the Big Easy they don’t recognize that they’re less than 45 minutes away from one of the best fishing spots in the country. In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that’s caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they’ll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny tries his hand at the seine net to catch some shrimp. Then meets up with Chef Dave to cook up some amazing Shrimp and Grits. After, Travel to Jekyll Island for the Shrimp and Grits Festival.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends ‪@ben_moon‬ and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Embracing passion. Devotion to craft. Never being in a rush. That’s the ethos of Mañana, a surf and apparel company based right here in Austin, Texas. Our friend and Mañana Founder Alec stopped by the Huckberry Gear Lab to show us some of the tools he uses everyday while hand shaping surfboards.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: After starting turkey season off on the road, it's time for us to come back home to Pennsylvania and hunt some turkeys on our home turf! Also joining us this week are our good friends from The Grind Outdoors who come in to hunt some long beards with us.
