programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When violent criminals strike, the FBI strikes back, employing every available resource, and creating new ones when necessary. From forensic science to criminal profiling, specialized intelligence to global fugitive tracking, the agents of the FBI battle the bad guys with a most powerful arsenal: the crime-fighter's toolbox. This special episode of The FBI Files celebrates the groundbreaking science, investigative technique, and gut-level instinct that has made the FBI the world's premier law enforcement agency.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 70s and early 80s, a terrorist group known as the FALN is suspected of setting off bombs in major U.S. cities. Their goal - to bring attention to the Puerto Rican independence movement. As the bombings escalate, innocent lives are lost. FBI agents and police are is in a deadly race to stop this murderous group with a dangerous cause.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a rash of home invasion robberies take place in the metropolitan Detroit area. The thieves turn out to be part of a local gang dubbed the Home Invaders. Their crimes extend to insurance fraud, theft, and illegal lottery schemes. The Violent Crimes Task Force (VCTF) opens an investigation, and with the cooperation of a gang member who was apprehended at the scene of a crime, they are able to obtain the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of 16 gang members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February 1988, a record store clerk in Sandusky, Ohio, was fatally shot in his van. After discovering a night deposit bag with thousands of dollars in the vehicle, police knew that robbery was not the motive, and began to investigate other possibilities. FBI agents learned that several motorcycle gang members had been stopped nearby on a traffic violation shortly after the murder and theorized that the clerk's murder may have been a botched hit carried out by a gang member.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1999, Police investigate two brutal murders in two small towns located hundreds of miles apart. The crimes seem random and unrelated, until investigators discover a terrifying link. Local police and the FBI must untangle a web of liesto stop a dangerous gang that will kill a man for his Identity.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June 1973, a young girl was abducted from a state park on the Missouri River while camping with her family. Several months passed with no leads, then an FBI agent took a particular interest in the case. Using a new technique known as criminal profiling, he predicted that the kidnapper would contact the girl's family on the one-year anniversary of her abduction. When this prediction came true, the FBI agent noted behavioral clues, hoping that they could lead him to the kidnapper.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Georgia, a series of bizarre shootings terrorizes the town of East Point. Two people are killed, and two are critically wounded. At first the shootings seem targeted, then they seem random. As the body count climbs, the killer taunts law enforcement with mysterious notes. Agents believe the shooter will continue until he is deador behind bars.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, the death of a government witness, and the suspicious circumstances surrounding it, lead the FBI and local authorities to suspect corruption in the highest levels of the police force. With the help of a cooperating witness, investigators find the scope of the corruption is far greater that they first thought. Authorities struggle to capture the rouge officers, men who once swore to uphold the law, but now use their power to commit heinous crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1990 and 1991, Chicago police and the FBI were on the trail of a bank robber whose holdups were becoming increasingly violent. The criminal consistently used stolen Japanese cars to carry out the robberies, so authorities hoped to identify him by tracking vehicle thefts. When they finally located the man known as the bearded bandit, they learned that he did not work alone and he had made a pact never to surrender.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1991, the Safe Streets Task Force, a joint FBI / Washington D.C. Metropolitan Police Department organization, begins conducting an investigation into the violent activities of a local gang called the K Street Crew. Gang members are suspected of involvement in several area homicides. The FBI approaches several witnesses, hoping to convince them to testify against the gang members. Seven potential witnesses are murdered during the course of the investigation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When violent criminals strike, the FBI strikes back, employing every available resource, and creating new ones when necessary. From forensic science to criminal profiling, specialized intelligence to global fugitive tracking, the agents of the FBI battle the bad guys with a most powerful arsenal: the crime-fighter's toolbox. This special episode of The FBI Files celebrates the groundbreaking science, investigative technique, and gut-level instinct that has made the FBI the world's premier law enforcement agency.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 12, 1997, two men use a sledgehammer to break into a Camden, NJ home. The homeowner shoots at the intruders, hitting one in the hand before they escape. Camden Police respond and track the suspects to a nearby park. One of the men shoots at the officer before police arrest his accomplice. The man gives up the identity of the shooter. Twice, police stake out homes where they believe the shooter is hiding, but he eludes them.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At 9:30 am on the morning of January 30, 1997, Richmond, VA police respond to a report of shots fired at a local bank. Two masked men brandishing automatic weapons confront, and open fire on officers responding to the call. The gunmen exit the bank, and retreat on foot, eventually eluding the officers. The FBI soon responds, only to find one bank teller dead, another wounded, and the bank's security guard shot four times, yet still alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, extortionists plant a thousand pound bomb in a Nevada casino and demand millions of dollars, or they will detonate the device. The bomb is the largest explosive device the FBI has ever seen. Detonation would be a disaster. Agents and bomb experts must disarm the deadly device, and stop the dangerous extortionist who built it.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, a ruthless grab for power leads to a full-scale mob war. The local Mafia crime family splits in two as the young and the old fight to the death. The FBI is caught in the middle as they infiltrate the syndicate through informants and high-tech surveillance. Agents must find a way to bring down the organization before their civil war leads to innocent causalities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Boston, FBI agents and local police tracked a gang of robbers who specialized in armored car takedowns. Their MO was familiar -- the gang used precise timing to steal millions in cash and burned their getaway cars to destroy evidence. As the robberies grew more violent, agents launched a complex sting: To trap a deadly ring of thieves and shut down their dangerous operation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1988, new light was shed on the mysterious death of a South Carolina farmer when a criminal confessed that two prominent community members hired him to commit murder. Local police and FBI agents arrested a wealthy businessman and later learned that, even behind bars, he commanded the power to corrupt and kill. Using prison informants, agents had to prevent him from murdering again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 70s and early 80s, a terrorist group known as the FALN is suspected of setting off bombs in major U.S. cities. Their goal - to bring attention to the Puerto Rican independence movement. As the bombings escalate, innocent lives are lost. FBI agents and police are is in a deadly race to stop this murderous group with a dangerous cause.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On the day before Thanksgiving, a mother discovered her 10 year-old son was missing from his school. No one knew how it could have happened. Within hours, the boy's entire family was frantically searching for him. The few leads in the case quickly turned cold and the FBI was called in to aid in the investigation. The search by agents and local authorities would cover a thousand miles to expose the kidnapper and find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At 9:30 am on the morning of January 30, 1997, Richmond, VA police respond to a report of shots fired at a local bank. Two masked men brandishing automatic weapons confront, and open fire on officers responding to the call. The gunmen exit the bank, and retreat on foot, eventually eluding the officers. The FBI soon responds, only to find one bank teller dead, another wounded, and the bank's security guard shot four times, yet still alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980's the New York City Police Department is fighting a losing battle in the war on drugs. Distributors and drug gangs in New York are making millions, and they will do anything to protect their profits. After two law enforcement officers are targeted, hundreds of police officers and FBI agents devise a bold plan to crackdown on the drug gangs and shut down their deadly business.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the Spring of 1997, a killer preying on senior citizens terrorizes the River Parish area of Southern Louisiana. By May, local police and the New Orleans FBI are exploring a connection between the April 9 murder of a 71-year old widow and the May 9 murder of a retired couple. A month later, authorities forward information on the crimes to the FBI's Behavioral Science Unit in Quantico, VA, hoping a profile will help them narrow the field of possible suspects.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 12, 1997, two men use a sledgehammer to break into a Camden, NJ home. The homeowner shoots at the intruders, hitting one in the hand before they escape. Camden Police respond and track the suspects to a nearby park. One of the men shoots at the officer before police arrest his accomplice. The man gives up the identity of the shooter. Twice, police stake out homes where they believe the shooter is hiding, but he eludes them.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1996, two men entered a pawnshop in Birmingham, Alabama, and ruthlessly murdered the employees. Unbeknownst to the killers, a secret video surveillance camera recorded the shooting. Local police and the FBI released images of the crime to the media, and were quickly able to identify the perpetrators. Now authorities had to find two cold-blooded killers who knew that they were being pursued for murder one.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A man is found suffocated in his Pennsylvania home, his checkbook, credit cards and vehicle appear to have been stolen. Fingerprints from the victim identify a recent escapee from a minimum-security prison, as well as his girlfriend. Investigators flag the dead man's credit cards, and are alerted when one is used in North Dakota. The FBI is called in and joins another task force already assembled because of a suspected kidnapping.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1984, the son of a successful real estate developer was kidnapped in front of his father's business in Miami. After the father received a $3 million ransom demand from a self-proclaimed terrorist, the FBI became involved. Based on witness descriptions of the car used in the kidnapping, authorities began to suspect a pair of Colombian nationals with a known grudge against the developer's family.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1992, a man returned to his Memphis home and discovered that his wife was missing. The husband, as well as his friends, family and neighbors began to receive ransom calls. FBI agents noticed that one neighbor seemed to have the best rapport with the kidnapper. They began to question his level of involvement, but had to proceed carefully, knowing that he could be their only link to the missing woman.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980s, the drug trade ravages Chicago's inner city neighborhoods and violent crime threatens to destroy entire communities. As drug profits grow, gangs rule the streets. One of the most dangerous is the El Rukns. FBI Agents team up with state and local police to bring them down, but in the process, uncover a bizarre and frightening terrorist plot.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On October 2, 1987, a Boston police officer responding to a domestic disturbance call was fatally wounded. Local authorities launched a citywide manhunt, but were only able to find the fingerprints of the chief suspect. Believing that he had fled the area, the FBI followed the suspect's trail to the west coast and then across the Mexican border, always aware of the desperation of a cop killer and of the need for justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In September 1997, a team of masked gunmen robbed an armored car facility in Los Angeles, and made off with $18.9 million, the largest takeover heist in U.S. history. An employee believed she recognized the voice of one of the robbers, and FBI agents began conducting surveillance on a former employee of the facility. With only one piece of physical evidence, a fragment of a vehicle taillight, authorities hoped to connect him to the crime, and locate his accomplices.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A California bank manager panics and calls in the FBI after the door to his vault refuses to open. Upon inspection, the vault has been blasted into from the ceiling, and over $2 million in valuables is gone. When agents find no clues as to the robbers or their whereabouts in California, they send details of the crime to other FBI field offices. It is not long before agents in Ohio are investigating a bank vault robbery that is strikingly similar to the California heist.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the southwest one serial bank robber claimed his loot went to the poor, but this thief was no folk hero. He had a gun and was willing to shoot. The gunman was desperate to stay free, a threat to anyone in his way. The FBI and U.S. marshals teamed up to capture a resourceful criminal who proved he would never stop fighting.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Lincoln County, Nebraska, a fugitive drug dealer engaged in a shootout with state troopers, wounding two of them, and eluded capture after a high-speed chase. Authorities immediately set up a statewide manhunt, connecting the fugitive to a murder in western Nebraska. A chance sighting led FBI agents to a second confrontation with the killer, who was more determined than ever to escape the law.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In October 1993, a robber surprised unsuspecting customers by dropping through the roof of a California bank. When police arrived, he escaped from the roof in a hail of bullets. A tip from a local resident led police and FBI agents to the perpetrator. They would soon learn that he had masterminded a local kidnapping, and held the fate of an innocent woman in his hands.

programme.title: Killers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: In Florida, a 13-year-old girl is found with stab wounds. In Colorado, a woman goes missing after a night out.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A jailing for the shocking murder of author Helen Bailey leads to a second conviction of another.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Steven Dean Gordon and Frank Cano murder at least four sex workers in California between 2012 and 2013.

programme.desc: Nick Groff and medium Tessa DelZoppo investigate Myrtles Plantation, constructed in 1797.

programme.title: Death Walker With Nick Groff
programme.desc: Nick will be the first person to conduct a paranormal investigation inside the Electro Magnetic Sanatorium.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: A killer evades justice for the murder of Diana Hanson for 38 years until genetic genealogy can identify him.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: Michelle Wyatt is found strangled to death in 1980; few leads arise until 41 years later, thanks to forensics.

programme.desc: A killer attacks his ex-girlfriend in a jealous frenzy and commits a brutal murder after a campaign of harassment.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder

programme.desc: While in the process of adopting a five-week-old baby, a mother takes him to work with her. While there, the baby inexplicably obtains a skull fracture while unsupervised.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young couple decided to celebrate their first wedding anniversary with a camping trip to Mount Hood. During the trip, the husband was shot and killed, and his wife told two different versions of the events which led to his death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man disappears one year to the day after beginning an affair with his friend's wife. 15 years later, with the help of a metal detector, police found evidence which would prove what had happened, and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Exploring how an American hit single from 1966 -- "The Cheater" by Bob Kuban and the In-Men -- foreshadowed the demise of the group's lead singer, Walter Scott.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police are dispatched to the scene of a shooting, and discover the victim's husband is one of their own: a homicide detective who says his wife accidentally shot herself in the head.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is shot to death in her store just one day before she is to testify against the man accused of robbing her. The robber becomes the prime suspect, but he has a solid alibi: a time-stamped videotape of his activities on the day of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two vanishes after a shopping trip. Her body is discovered a month later. Witnesses say they saw the victim being forced into a car by an unknown person.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind _ tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide _ but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman disappeared without a trace, there were two possible explanations: kidnapping or murder. Careful investigation, a forensic artist, and DNA profiling enabled police to find a single suspect, who was known to prey upon vulnerable women.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mysterious computer crash pushed a thriving manufacturing company to the brink of collapse, jeopardizing hundreds of employees' jobs. Forensic investigators must determine if the crash was the result of a computer defect, human error, or sabotage.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man tells police he shot an intruder who had attacked and murdered his wife. The husband paints a tragic picture and is dubbed a hero. Four years later, forensic evidence leads police to re-examine the motives of this so-called hero.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanishes after attending a party. The prime suspect had not one but two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome much circumstantial evidence. But forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1987 disappearance of Houston resident Tracy Jo Shine is recalled. The investigation went cold until 2000 when a 'cold case squad' learned that the woman's ex-boyfriend Michael Neal had bragged about killing her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When hunters found a skull in a Texas canyon, police found bits of clothing, small bones and a strand of hair. A forensic artist reconstructed her face. Now all they had to do was find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An unusual case involving the 1988 rape and murder of Nancy DePriest. After Chris Ochoa confessed, the case was closed. 8 years later, Achim Marino confessed to the same crime. DNA evidence cleared Ochoa while proving that Marino was the perpetrator.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two different men called police to report the same murder. Apparently, neither one knew that the other had called. The investigation uncovered even more unusual circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind _ tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman disappeared, police feared she was the latest victim in a string of similar crimes. A pair of bloody gloves, unique tire tracks, and ordinary grass and pine needles provided investigators with some extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found dead in a ravine, but crucial crime scene evidence had been washed away by severe thunderstorms. Twice, the trail turned cold. Almost 20 years later, an old hat and a chip of stainless steel brought the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young TV news producer is raped and murdered in her apartment. Police identify two suspects, but both are cleared of any wrongdoing. The case stalls for more than a year, and then investigators turn to the Commonwealth of Virginia's DNA Databank.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant Craig Bailey to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a victim is brutally murdered in his own bed, investigators find a shoe impression in the mud outside--physical evidence they hope will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Time of death becomes pivotal after a pregnant woman is found murdered in her air-conditioned bedroom. A striking similarity between her death and an HBO movie gives examiners the clues they need to thaw out the alibi of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Haunted by the disappearance of her mother, a young woman undertook an investigation of her own. Her mother's diary was in the cold case file; there, she discovered a dark family secret, which might have been the reason her mother vanished.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, the body of a young woman was discovered in an Ohio river. Most of the evidence had been washed away, but the victim's 6 year-old son unwittingly told investigators all they needed to know...without saying a word. The clue was in his genes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A fire erupted in Kings Cross Station in London, killing 31 people and injuring dozens more. Investigators pinpointed the cause of the fire, but it took state-of-the-art technology and fluid dynamics experts to explain why it became a deadly inferno.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was 1957, and California police were searching for a man who had committed several crimes in one night, including murder. They followed thousands of leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators proved an old adage: You can run, but you can't hide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an 11-year-old girl disappeared from a small town in a remote area of Alaska, investigators wondered if she'd been attacked by a bear or become lost in the dense woods. It turned out neither was true.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. More than 75 Seattle-area arsons are probed before he was discovered, partly through the use of forensic hypnosis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of 16-year-old Leanne Tiernan was discovered nine months after she disappeared. Forensic scientists found clues that painted a virtual portrait of her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Emergency dispatch received a call from a man who said his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy revealed that the gunshot wound was not self-inflicted and the evidence on her body would give police a golden opportunity to catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when a severed leg is discovered in the garbage. Conventional means of identifying the victim are impossible, leading investigators to rely on DNA, forensic anthropology and toxicology to identify the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The sensitive nose of a forensic examiner sniffs out murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police were puzzled by an obscure print found at a crime scene where one man had been killed and two teenage girls were seriously injured. Neither of the girls could identify their attacker. But one simple clue helped track the footsteps of a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at a trio of unsolved murders that occurred in Wichita Falls, Texas during the 1980s, details how a fourth murder from the same time period provided the police with more than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The founder of American Atheists disappeared in 1995 along with one of her sons and granddaughter, along with $500,000 in gold coins. The police homed in on several suspects, including David R. Waters, who worked for American Atheists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an American tourist in a Mexican resort focused law enforcement resources on both sides of the border. At first glance, the motive appeared to be robbery, but careful analysis of the forensic evidence pointed to something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Computers aid the police and FBI in solving a string of crimes in St. Louis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators sift through the ashes of a fire which killed a 40-year-old woman. The fire appeared to have been started by an unattended cigarette. On closer look, forensic scientists discover the cause was far more complicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The news of a flight attendant's brutal murder prompted the son of a victim who had been killed five years earlier to contact police. Both murders had similar MOs, and analysis of biological evidence proved that these were serial killings.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is shot to death in her store just one day before she is to testify against the man accused of robbing her. The robber becomes the prime suspect, but he has a solid alibi: a time-stamped videotape of his activities on the day of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a street fight took the life of a national wrestling champion, police had to determine if he was killed in cold blood, or in self-defense. A jury decided it was murder, and sentenced the accused to a minimum of twenty years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teen was killed by her parents in what they said was self-defense, but forensic evidence told otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Heavy rains and snow run-off carry manure into Milwaukee's water supply in 1993, leading to an epidemic of gastrointestinal illness affecting 400,000 people.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Scientists and detectives use DNA to solve a string of rapes and murders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Evidence reveals a teacher who complained of being stalked and harassed by another teacher was scamming police.

programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Exploring how an American hit single from 1966 -- "The Cheater" by Bob Kuban and the In-Men -- foreshadowed the demise of the group's lead singer, Walter Scott.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The development of technology could help solve a murder case that is twelve years old.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Computers aid the police and FBI in solving a string of crimes in St. Louis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Heavy rains and snow run-off carry manure into Milwaukee's water supply in 1993, leading to an epidemic of gastrointestinal illness affecting 400,000 people.

programme.desc: An 11-year-old boy comes down with a fever and diarrhea after eating an undercooked burger; when his condition worsens, his mother drives him to a hospital and doctors discover E. coli destroying his body.

programme.desc: Scientists and detectives use DNA to solve a string of rapes and murders.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: Tamika Huston had big dreams of becoming a singer and a promising future ahead of her, but when she inexplicably goes missing, friends and family worry they’ll never get to see her reach her full potential. A bad-boy boyfriend in Tamika’s past prompts investigators to wonder if perhaps he had something to do with her disappearance. The search for answers will lead law enforcement down a slew of different paths—will they ever be able to track down this beautiful young songstress?

programme.title: Deceived
programme.desc: Corey Jenkins was a dual athlete with a potential pro career in either baseball or football. When the time comes to sign a management agency, Corey is convinced by local agents that they are the only agents that will look out for his true interests - the only agents he can trust. But while everything seems to run smoothly at first, Corey is soon faced with money problems, despite a substantial signing bonus he received when he was drafted. Slow to suspect his slick talking agents, by the time Corey realizes he has been victimized by the very people he trusted, it is too late.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Charles Smith was a bright young man with huge musical aspirations. On one fateful night, all his dreams came to a close when he was found nearly dead at a crossroads in Atlanta. Quinn and Vince hit the streets and begin asking questions of what appears to be a homicide. After digging deeper into the party scene in Atlanta, they soon realize that the killer could be someone they never expected.

programme.title: Thou Shalt Not
programme.desc: In Bethesda, Maryland, Brittany Norwood’s quick fall from grace lands her in the center of a murder investigation that rattles the community. And later, in Pennsylvania, an irresistible sin creeps up behind a husband and wife meant to be together…until death do they part.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When Felicia Scott’s man demands a child she can’t give him, she dives into a homicidal tailspin to get him exactly what he wants. Then, Victoria Jackson commits the ultimate act of betrayal against one of her own family members, at her dangerously jealous man’s request.

programme.title: #Murder
programme.desc: 22-year-old Shannon Griffin was the new guy in St. Petersburg, Florida. Handsome but painfully shy, Shannon had trouble meeting friends in his new town – he preferred to stay home alone and play video games. So it came as an utter shock to his family when he is found shot to death behind an abandoned home. Detectives discover that Shannon turned to the Internet to meet new people. He made tons of friends online – but now that he was found dead, it appeared he also made some enemies.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Vanessa Coleman is dangerously in love. She’ll stand by her man as he tortures a frightened couple in a drug-induced rage all while she watches. Then Tamika Jasper-Barbary marries a handsome, hard worker, but when his job gets them in hot water, Tamika risks it all to save her love.

programme.title: #Murder
programme.desc: 15-year-old Mikarah Sanders and 16-year-old Matthew DuBois were two typical teenagers in a whirlwind romance. The two were inseparable; when they weren’t together, they were messaging on MySpace. But when a New Year’s Eve in Seattle ends in the mysterious shooting of Mikarah and Matthew, police scour social media to piece together the crime. Their search for answers would reveal a tale of jealousy, rage, and the murder of an innocent teen.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: As tensions rise between black liberation group, MOVE, and Philadelphia police, city officials drop a bomb on the group’s headquarters, killing most of its members and leaving several other citizens homeless.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When popular grad student Denita Smith is found lying in a pool of blood at the bottom of her stairwell, police are baffled as to who would kill this likeable young woman. As the investigation unfolds, detectives uncover a deadly love triangle of betrayal, jealousy and the unsettling possibility that this death may have been caused by one of their own.

programme.title: Deceived
programme.desc: Abraham Kennard was a fast-talking pastor with an ambitious real estate investment opportunity. Hundreds of pastors and parishioners from churches across the country were lured by Kennard’s lavish lifestyle and promises of enormous returns. But though the millions poured in, the returns never poured out, revealing this supposed man of God…to be a man of greed.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: When an elderly man, Edward, who always paid his rent on time, failed to do so, the apartment manager calls in a welfare check. As it turns out, Edward was tortured and murdered inside his apartment. Quinn and Vince hightail it to the scene and upon investigating, soon realize murder is not always accomplished…alone.

programme.title: Thou Shalt Not
programme.desc: Tyrone Page tries to take the high road while his twin, Jerome, prefers lower alternatives but fate leads them both to life on the dark side. Then, AJ Nelson’s life of rejection and heartache leaves him destitute. With nothing to lose, someone will pay the ultimate price from his pursuit of wealth.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Troubled housewife Carolyn King deserts her family in search of a clean slate, only to find her perfect match in a local convict Bradley Martin. Next, teen mom Angel Glenn risks it all to support her baby. But when she crosses paths with a bad boy, Angel leaves her world of seduction for a life of crime.

programme.title: #Murder
programme.desc: Aspiring rapper, Naressa Turner was a talented single mom from St. Paul with big dreams and an even bigger social media presence. Well known throughout her community because of her active social media use, Naressa was on her way to a successful rap career. But when she is found fatally shot in the passenger seat of an SUV, investigators uncover shocking clues on her Facebook account that could point to her killer.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: Texas has a rich and diverse history, but in 2015, the city of Houston falls prey to string of lethal armored car robberies striking terror in the streets. Investigators must pull off an elaborate sting operation to bring the perpetrators to justice.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Neighborhood character Willie Bell is found naked and dead early in the morning. With nothing else to go on, Quinn and Velazquez discover that Willie was seen with two different women the night before he was found. With two prime suspects, they try to find the truth.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When popular grad student Denita Smith is found lying in a pool of blood at the bottom of her stairwell, police are baffled as to who would kill this likeable young woman. As the investigation unfolds, detectives uncover a deadly love triangle of betrayal, jealousy and the unsettling possibility that this death may have been caused by one of their own. ↵

programme.title: Deceived
programme.desc: When hopeless romantic Rose Anglade met Paul Francois, she thought the Lord had finally given her someone she could grow old with. Eager to begin her new life with the man of her dreams, Rose takes Paul’s advice and sells her home in New York City and shares her assets with her soul mate. But unbeknownst to Rose, her smooth talking lothario has been carefully orchestrating his control over her finances, and when Francois disappears, it isn't just her money that he's taken.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Demetrius Robbins was a stand-up husband and father who made it a point to serve his family, until one night where the unthinkable happened. Quinn and Vince go from a crime scene where there is no body, to rapidly piecing together that Demetrius Robbins is the victim in a much larger and horrific crime that they never could have imagined.

programme.title: Thou Shalt Not
programme.desc: In Towson, MD young Lewin Powell III is known in his upper-middle class community as the good son. But when years of academic pressure from his parents come to a head, Lewin snaps unleashing hell on his mother. Later, church leaders Christy and Neil Edgar’s strong belief in discipline takes a deadly turn.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When Felicia Scott’s man demands a child she can’t give him, she dives into a homicidal tailspin to get him exactly what he wants. Then, Victoria Jackson commits the ultimate act of betrayal against one of her own family members, at her dangerously jealous man’s request.

programme.title: #Murder
programme.desc: 16-year-old Ivan Redding was a talented tattoo artist who moved to West Palm Beach, Florida. But Ivan made enemies when he posted on Facebook that he would always rep his hometown of Riviera. Many local kids fought with Ivan, and the violence continued to escalate until he was fatally shot – but by whom? Rumors were swirling that someone threatened to kill Ivan on Facebook, but the post had since been deleted. Detectives turn to cyberspace to unlock the mystery behind a murder sparked by social media, and fueled by jealousy and wounded pride.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: In Scottsdale, Arizona, women in the city fall prey a handsome playboy who enjoys the party lifestyle as one of city’s rich and famous. But when the FBI learns he’s a serial grifter running an investment scam, the party’s over.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: A handsome and ambitious young man named Kristopher Miller begins a steamy romance with a patron at his bar, Kim Griffin. But their romance is cut short when Kristopher is gunned down on the doorsteps of his own home. Investigators initially expect the crime to be linked to gang violence, which is prevalent in the area. However, after digging deeper they discover a chilling tale of jealousy and vengeance.

programme.title: Deceived

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Jimmie Atkins was well-liked by everyone in his neighborhood. Days pass and no one had seen or heard from him which was quite uncharacteristic. The APD were called and they discovered that he was murdered inside his own home. Quinn and Vince rush to the scene only to discover that people who you love and hold dearest to your heart, can make it stop beating.

programme.title: Thou Shalt Not
programme.desc: Family is all that matters to Kim Wolfe until she meets Stacie. As the relationship goes south, Kim finds herself questioning everything, even her sanity. Then, Robert Barnes leads a charmed life with gifts beyond measure but when tragedy strikes, he may find himself standing in the crossfire.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Shy, anonymous twenty year old Debra Brown falls for serial child predator Alton Coleman and gets pulled into his twisted and deadly world. Later, seventeen year old Chakkira Wonnum escapes an abusive home only to run into the arms of a dangerous drug addict who forces her to commit an unspeakable act.

programme.title: #Murder
programme.desc: 28-year-old Michael Sandy was a young designer and social butterfly who lived in a trendy borough of Brooklyn. In addition to his close friends, Michael sought companionship through online chat rooms. But on an October night in 2006, Michael’s fun turned to horror when his habit of trusting strangers on the Internet placed him in a life-threatening position. To bring Michael justice, investigators must scour the web to put a face to a screen name.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Carlton Benn was a great person who worked for CARE, a disaster relief company which provided disaster relief to those in need. One day in May of 2006, Carlton’s roommate reported to police that he was dead. Vince and Quinn immediately come to action.

programme.title: Deceived
programme.desc: Abraham Kennard was a fast-talking pastor with an ambitious real estate investment opportunity. programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Mark Schaller was new to the Atlanta area. While out one night in early October 2002, Mark began chatting with another patron at a bar. Chatting quickly became something more and that was to Mark’s liking. Unfortunately, it turned out to be something no one could dreamt of. Quinn and Vince are assigned the case. As they dig deeper and deeper into who committed this heinous crime, they soon realize that this was no personal attack and that the killer could be linked to something far greater.

programme.title: Thou Shalt Not
programme.desc: Willa Blanc will put her son’s loyalty to the test when she takes an unrighteous path in search of riches… and later, Oklahoma drifter Cedric Norris’ road to redemption is suppressed by the devilish voices in his head.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Yvette Gay is a simple girl desperate for companionship and when she falls for an angry man, he drags her into a murderous plot. Vishawn Mills finds the man of her dreams but when an innocent friendship with the landlord intimidates her jealous boyfriend, her dream becomes a nightmare.

programme.title: Deceived
programme.desc: Tammi McCreary thought she had met the man of her dreams in Eric Perteet. A charismatic and ambitious doctor from Chicago, Eric quickly swept Tammi off her feet. Shortly after their wedding, Tammi's new husband is arrested at the local hospital, and she is faced with a string of shocking lies and the knowledge that she is not the only woman who has fallen prey to Eric's deceitful ways.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Ayesha Turner lived a quiet life in southwest, Atlanta. One evening, that all changed. A few days go by and Quinn and Vince are notified of a missing person’s report. They begin their case of trying to figure out what happen to Ayesha Turner.

programme.title: Thou Shalt Not
programme.desc: Derrick Todd Lee holds nothing sacred as his peeping tom inclinations prove to be a gateway and hell is unleashed on the Creole State. programme.desc: Emily Chang meets Instacart CEO Fidji Simo in her hometown in the South of France, learning about her journey from a small fishing village to the upper echelons of Silicon Valley.

programme.title: Momentum
programme.desc: Japan is seeing a renaissance in its chip industry. Spearheaded by giants and startups alike, what lessons are there for the world as this digital transformation takes shape?

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa. Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping the decisions of traders across the Middle East, Africa and beyond.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa. Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping the decisions of traders across the Middle East, Africa and beyond.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: From London, essential morning viewing to stay ahead of the day's market trends with news stories from the U.S. and Asia in the lead-up to the opening of European markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Opening Trade
programme.desc: The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.title: The Pulse with Francine Lacqua
programme.desc: Based in London, Francine Lacqua speaks with high-profile guests in the heart of global business, economics, finance and politics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Brief
programme.desc: "Bloomberg Brief" delivers the market news, data and analysis viewers need to set their agendas.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Jonathan, Lisa and Annmarie survey the economy and global markets with daily conversations with leaders and decision makers, from Wall Street to Washington and beyond, to cover the latest in business, investment and geopolitics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Open Interest
programme.desc: Delivering the market-moving news anyone needs to know to get a jump start on the U.S. trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology" takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the U.S. markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled "Bloomberg West," is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bloomberg Real Yield
programme.desc: Not everyone has a lot of money to invest, which is why Bloomberg has financial indices that are based on fixed income, which is also the focus on this weekly show. The program covers news and trends in the fixed-income market and includes interviews with guests from major financial institutions. "Bloomberg Real Yield" incorporates data and analysis from terminal bond experts to help dive into topics that are moving the bond markets in order to help empower viewers to make knowledgeable financial decisions.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: Very Local: Very New Mexico
programme.desc: Meet the hosts of the shows on Very Local, and learn about the programs highlighting The Land of Enchantment.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasn’t had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: When it comes to nature, Maddie Carlin is a self-proclaimed Debbie Downer. Kinga is in Milwaukee to convince her to give nature another chance. They’re traveling across the state, looking for an adventure to inspire Maddie to get off the couch!

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Love hurts: These are real-life stories of Americans who were swindled by people who claimed to love them.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Willington may be young, but this activist knows exactly what he’s looking for. Will it be fashionista Guerds, fellow actor Georgerinna, or doctor-to-be Pheddy?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Single father Kendal Fenwick is the 295th homicide in Baltimore in 2015. Family and investigators wonder whether his efforts to curb drugs and violence in his neighborhood made him a target. Or is it something else entirely?

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: 30 Min Documentaries
programme.desc: 30 Min Documentaries

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: After a snowy day in Western Pennsylvania, a horrifying discovery leads investigators down a heartbreaking and twisted path. They'll seek swift justice for an innocent victim deceived.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Love is all around us when you take the time to look. Whether it’s a couple still falling in love, or a community organizer making sure every child has a birthday party, there are heartwarming stories all across this country.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: From fencing, to ninja warrior training, to boxing and Tai Chi, Rob discovers an inner strength he never knew he had…while getting kicked in the keister.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day explore the many sides of Lawrenceville. From sword fighting and thrifting to making wine and burgers, the guys experience the beauty of this eclectic neighborhood.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A teenager vanishes from her home one fall morning in 1999. Her body is discovered 17 days later, seven miles away. It takes more than 15 years for the heartbreaking truth to come out.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: In this battle, it's sink or swim. Chef Josiah of Purple Ocean Superfood Bar in Waterford Lakes takes on Chef Daniel of The Moderne in the Mills 50 district. We’ve got a seafood extravaganza on this episode of Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero takes to the streets to ask people about the wildest, wackiest news stories. In "Odd Jobs," contestants learn about a kid-run food truck, a school board member with a special license and a senior citizen that's into heavy work.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Scott's life revolves around everyone's favorite four-legged friends, from rescuing and caring for countless dogs, his spirit is unwavering. Today Meaghan gives back a day full of moments for him and his beloved canine companion.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Loosen that belt: Today we're filling up on comforting classics. From thick focaccia pizza to the juiciest smoked brisket, we guarantee there won't be room for dessert.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Very Local: Very New Mexico
programme.desc: Meet the hosts of the shows on Very Local, and learn about the programs highlighting The Land of Enchantment.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: KOAT Celebrates 70 Years
programme.desc: For 70 years KOAT has been part of your family. You’ve let us into your homes, to bring you the news that matters most. In this special program, we bring back those familiar faces to revisit some of the biggest stories we have covered over 7 decades.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Mikey’s getting married soon and the clock is ticking to get his teeth picture-perfect. Lynn’s embarrassed by the color of her teeth and won’t wait another moment for a white smile. Can the FIXT team get the work done in time?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In a serene community, a beloved doctor is bludgeoned in her own home. Investigators uncover a conspiracy that rocks the close-knit neighborhood to its core​​.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nation’s largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand… or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, America’s native spirit.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: In “Free Spirit,” award-winning bartender and host Kate Gerwin takes to the road and meets people in their workplaces and their favorite watering holes.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Celebrate some of the Midwest's holiday favorites. Where scotcheroos take center stage, snicker salads delight, and the pink stuff surprises the pallet.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact travels to Michigan where small businesses owners are finding solutions to lower health care costs. Plus, an expert on presidential transitions breaks down the process. And, we travel to James Madison’s Montpelier estate to learn how archaeologists are digging to uncover the history of the people buried there.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and “butts up” shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Join WNBA player and Olympian Angel McCoughtry as she shows us the people and places that put Baltimore on the map. From sailing the Chesapeake, to sampling street foods, McCoughtry pulls back the curtain on what makes the Charm City so special.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: What's On The Menu?

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda Machon meets with a different guest each episode who will show off their favorite spots in Albuquerque and the best way to experience this one-of-a-kind city. This series is all about discovering everything that makes ABQ unique and exciting.

programme.title: Too Close To The Sun
